RAB-0012: PATIENT: [REDACTED] 12, 56-year-old male. MRN: [REDACTED]. INDICATION FOR OPERATION: 56-year-old man with a 1.3 cm posterior segment right lower lobe ground-glass predominant nodule, PET-negative, undergoing Ion robotic biopsy to rule out early adenocarcinoma. PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Right lower lobe ground-glass nodule. POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Same. PROCEDURE: Robotic navigational bronchoscopy using Intuitive Ion system (CPT 31627), radial EBUS (CPT 31654), transbronchial lung biopsy (CPT 31628). After general anesthesia and ETT placement, CT-based navigation was planned and automatic registration was successful. The catheter was advanced to the posterior RLL; radial EBUS showed a faint adjacent halo consistent with ground-glass density. Augmented fluoroscopy and respiratory-gated breath-hold were used to optimize alignment. Four forceps biopsies were obtained with minimal bleeding. No brushing or BAL performed. The patient tolerated the procedure well with no immediate complications.
